turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Yi Sun-sin.
turn.1: Why were the Sino-Japanese wars important to Yi Sun-sin?
turn.2: King Seonjo, who was desperate for victories to loosen the Japanese grip on his kingdom, gave permission for the attack.
turn.3: Did anything happen during the attack?
turn.4: When General Kim gave Admiral Yi his orders, the admiral refused to carry them out, for he knew that the location given by the spy was studded with sunken rocks and was thus extremely dangerous.
turn.6: Admiral Yi also refused because he did not trust the words of spies.
turn.8: When General Kim informed the king of Admiral Yi's refusal, the admiral's enemies at court quickly insisted on his replacement by General Won Gyun, former commander of the Gyeongsang Province Western Fleet & Commander of the Jeolla Province Ground Forces.
turn.10: They advised that Admiral Yi be arrested.
turn.11: What happened after he was arrested?
turn.12: As a result, in 1597, Yi was relieved of command, placed under arrest, and taken to Seoul in chains to be imprisoned and tortured.
